ALLEGATION: Staff grabbed youth around neck making it difficult for him to breath
while threatening to hurt youth, call the police, and tell others youth assaulted staff.
INVESTIGATION:
I reviewed intake dated 03/12/2021. It states Youth A was kicking his shoes at the
staff desk where Staff Person 1 was sitting. Staff Person 1 told Youth A to go to his
room and sit down and that Staff Person 1came up to Youth A and grabbed him with
both hands around his neck, making it difficult for Youth A to breath. Staff Person 1
told Youth A that he would "(expletive) him up, call the cops, and tell them Youth A
assaulted staff." Staff Person 2 witnessed the altercation. Youth A was upset due to
the incident and left the facility and has since returned to the facility.
I interviewed Youth A onsite with DHHS worker on 03/15/2021. He presented as
oppositional noting that he does not know when he was placed and that his
placement to date has been “alright”. He reports AWOL-ing with another youth
either Friday or Saturday indicating they were out all night and throughout the next
day in which nothing happened prior. He reports a few days prior that Staff Person 1
was sitting on the bench inside the cottage and that he was kicking his shoes at the
staff desk. Youth A reports Staff Person 1 instructed to go to his bedroom or to sit
on the bench, and that he also told him Staff Person 1 would “(expletive) him up, call
2

the cops, and say he (Staff Person 1) was assaulted by his shoes”. Youth A reports
Staff Person 1 then choked him because he said Youth A had his phone, at which
Youth A reports he went AWOL. Youth A reports informing Staff Person 3 and 4 of
the incident and that the police were then contacted. Youth A reports the other
residents were in their bedrooms and did not see the incident and that Staff Person
2 “went along with it”. He reports this being the first incident involving Staff Person 1
noting that he just walked around downtown when he AWOL’d and that staff did not
follow him.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 onsite with DHHS worker on 04/15/2021. He reports
being employed with the facility for three months with no disciplinary issues and has
taken verbal de-escalation training noting that the facility does not restrain residents.
He reports all other residents being in their bedrooms and that Youth A did not want
to go to bed. He reports Youth A being verbally aggravated toward staff and that he
used calming statements to Youth A. Staff Person 1 reports Youth A threw a shoe
and hitting him in the head. He then states walking toward Youth A and giving him
his shoe back, in which Youth A pushed him. He reports informing Youth A that
throwing the shoe and pushing him is considered assault which Youth A stated that
it did not before running out of the cottage. Staff Person 1 denies choking and
touching Youth A. Staff Person 1 reports Youth A and another peer returned from
AWOL the day prior to the incident and that Youth A was upset that the other peer
was removed from the facility.
I reviewed DHHS worker email summary of her interview with Staff Person 2 dated
03/10/2021. A summary of her interview with Staff Person 2 is as follows:
It was shower time and Youth A was refusing and using profanity to staff
and was asked to shower or go to his bedroom as he could not be near
the shower area while others were inside. Youth A was verbally
aggressive while sitting at the staff desk and threw a towel at Staff Person
2 which he ignored. Youth A then threw his house-shoe at Staff Person 1
hitting him in the head, which Staff Person 1 exclaimed, “You just
assaulted me, and I didn’t do anything but told you to go to your room”.
Youth A then attempted to take off his other shoe to assault Staff Person 1
in which indicated that he could call the police. Youth A then pushed Staff
Person 1 and then walked out of the cottage. Youth A then threw a log
through the window, walked inside the cottage, and then exited. An
incident report was completed and that the police were not called until the
next day when Youth A returned to the facility. Staff Person 1 did come
to grab the other show from Youth A and denied Staff Person 1 choking
Youth 1 and states Youth 1 stating “You can’t touch me” and that Staff
Person 1 gave back Youth A his house-shoe. Staff Person 2 states he
was present during the entire incident and that no residents observed as
they were showering.
3

I interviewed Staff Person 3 onsite with DHHS worker dated 03/15/2021. She
reports the next day of Youth A returning from AWOL that Youth A informed her of
the allegations. She reports Youth A indicated that Staff Person 1 informed him that
it was alright to sit in the vestibule and that he was then instructed to go to his
bedroom. Staff Person 1 then questioned Youth A where his phone was at and
asked Youth A and then proceeded to choke him stating that Staff Person 1 would
claim that he was assaulted by Youth A. She reports Youth A denied any pain or
injuries.
I reviewed incident report dated 03/11/2021 for incident on 03/10/2021. It states
Youth A refusing to go to bedroom, swearing at staff, attempting to take phone, and
throwing shoe and pushing staff.
I reviewed incident report dated 03/12/2021. It states Youth A AWOL-ing with
another youth after the group returning from playing basketball.
I reviewed incident report dated 03/12/2021. It states Youth A AWOL-ing by breaking
out his bedroom window. Youth A was found in the community and refused to return
to the facility and went out of the line of sight of staff. After filing a police report and
return to the facility that staff observed Youth A walking back to the cottage and
proceeded to break other windows of the cottage before entering and going to bed.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe discipline,
including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any manner.
ANALYSIS: There is no conclusive evidence to indicate staff choked Youth
A as he alleges. Youth A had a prior history of AWOL-ing from
the facility before AWOL-ing again in which Youth A threw a
shoe and pushed staff before leaving.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
No change to the current license is recommended.
